definition: To deviate from a direct path or course, typically to avoid an obstacle or danger. This word is commonly used when referring to physical movement, such as sidestepping or evading something in order to prevent a collision or harm.

examples.english: I had to swerve to avoid the car.
He tried to evade the questions.

examples.german: Sie konnte dem Schlag nicht ausweichen.
Der LÃ¤ufer musste dem Hindernis ausweichen.
examples.english: The runner had to sidestep the obstacle.
We should avoid the traffic jam.
